-- Migration: Add Google OAuth Support to User Model

/\*
This migration adds Google OAuth fields to the User model.

Changes:

1. Adds googleId (unique) - stores Google's user identifier
2. Adds googleEmail - stores the email from Google account
3. Makes password optional - OAuth users won't have a password

The migration is handled by Prisma ORM, so you don't need to write SQL.
Just run: npm run prisma:migrate
\*/

-- The actual SQL migration will be generated by Prisma and saved in:
-- backend/prisma/migrations/{timestamp}\_add_google_oauth/

-- After running prisma:migrate, the User table will have these new columns:
-- ALTER TABLE "User" ADD COLUMN "googleId" TEXT UNIQUE NULL;
-- ALTER TABLE "User" ADD COLUMN "googleEmail" TEXT NULL;
-- ALTER TABLE "User" ALTER COLUMN "password" DROP NOT NULL;

-- No data loss occurs with this migration. All existing users are preserved.
